There was a bug in my twitter app, and the feed stopped showing more tweets as I scrolled down. There was an end to the scrolling. For a moment I felt free and relieved.

The first tweet of a thread is like a tiny landing page, trying to make you click. 

I hate having my timeline filled with those, as it breaks the flow of information. Feels like ads.

Twitter needs a better UX so people get thread engagement without resorting to sales pitches.

The hardest part of being a founder for me is that I need to focus on marketing over building.

I wanted to create my dream job, where I could do what I love everyday (code and ux) without a boss telling me what to do.

Turns out it doesn‚Äôt work if I only do that.

I‚Äôm starting to think the number one skill to have as a founder is the ability to switch context quickly.

Today, I can‚Äôt get myself to focus on code because I‚Äôm still high from the marketing I did yesterday.

I lose a ton of productivity like this. Need to improve.

Thanks to all the support I got for @logologydesign over the last couple of days, I feel way more energy to keep pushing  and finally make it profitable.

The indie journey has ups and downs, but the organic support from other makers is a super power.

Let's goooooo!

It‚Äôs a whole other level.
